interface.name: zliri_lockscreen_v1
interface.description: This interface provides notifications of lock and unlock events. Only one client at a time can bind to this interface. You may want to restrict this interface to whitelisted clients.

entry.name: already_bound
entry.summary: a client already bound this interface

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request indicates that the client will not use the lock screen object any more. Objects that have been created through this instance are not affected.

request.name: get_handle
request.description: Request a new handle for the lock screen.

event.name: locked
event.description:
This event is sent by the compositor when outputs needs to be locked. It is also sent when the client binds to the interface, if the outputs are already locked at that time.
Surfaces on locked outputs might still be visible for a while even after this event is sent, due to an animation of the lock screen.

request.name: unlock
request.description: Let the compositor know the user has successfully entered a password, PIN or any other supported authentication method.

request.name: destroy
request.description:
This request destroys the handle.
Destroying an active handle without unlocking first will keep the output locked. The compositor might still hide all surfaces, but that really depends on the implementation.
